bill_title: codify the common law of rescission as applied to life insurance contracts.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to codify the common law of rescission as applied to life insurance contracts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If a life insurance policy is deemed void, void ab initio, or otherwise terminated or extinguished in accordance with the law for any reason other than nonpayment of premium, the owner of the policy or the owner's designated representative may recover from the insurer all premiums paid on the policy plus interest on those payments at the rate set in § 54-3-4. Section 2. The provisions of this Act apply to all life insurance policies that have not lapsed for non-payment of premiums as of July 1, 2013 and to all policies issued after June 30, 2013. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.093 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
